domain.name: Finance
domain.description: The Finance domain encompasses all processes related to managing, planning, and overseeing the financial activities of an organization.

processes.name: Financial Planning
processes.description: Involves creating strategies for allocating financial resources to achieve organizational goals.

subprocesses.name: Budgeting
subprocesses.description: Formulating a plan for the allocation of financial resources for different departments.

subprocesses.name: Budget Preparation
subprocesses.description: Collecting financial data and preparing the budget draft.

subprocesses.name: Budget Approval
subprocesses.description: Reviewing and approving the budget draft by upper management.

subprocesses.name: Forecasting
subprocesses.description: Predicting future financial conditions based on historical data.

subprocesses.name: Data Analysis
subprocesses.description: Analyzing historical financial data to identify trends.

subprocesses.name: Scenario Planning
subprocesses.description: Developing financial scenarios based on different assumptions.

subprocesses.name: Resource Allocation
subprocesses.description: Distributing available financial resources across various departments and projects.

subprocesses.name: Priority Setting
subprocesses.description: Determining priorities for resource allocation.

subprocesses.name: Resource Tracking
subprocesses.description: Monitoring the use of allocated resources.

processes.name: Financial Reporting
processes.description: Includes processes for compiling financial statements and reports for internal and external stakeholders.

subprocesses.name: Financial Statement Preparation
subprocesses.description: Preparing balance sheets, income statements, and cash flow statements.

subprocesses.name: Data Collection
subprocesses.description: Gathering financial data needed for statements.

subprocesses.name: Statement Compilation
subprocesses.description: Compiling and formatting financial statements.

subprocesses.name: Regulatory Compliance
subprocesses.description: Ensuring all financial reporting adheres to legal and regulatory standards.

subprocesses.name: Standard Implementation
subprocesses.description: Implementing financial reporting standards.

subprocesses.name: Audit Coordination
subprocesses.description: Coordinating internal and external audits.

subprocesses.name: Management Reporting
subprocesses.description: Creating reports for management to support decision-making processes.

subprocesses.name: Performance Analysis
subprocesses.description: Analyzing financial performance against targets.

subprocesses.name: Variance Reporting
subprocesses.description: Reporting discrepancies between planned and actual figures.

processes.name: Treasury Management
processes.description: Managing the organization's liquidity, investments, and financial risk.

subprocesses.name: Cash Management
subprocesses.description: Monitoring and managing cash flow and liquidity.

subprocesses.name: Cash Flow Forecasting
subprocesses.description: Predicting future cash flow needs.

subprocesses.name: Liquidity Management
subprocesses.description: Ensuring sufficient liquidity to meet obligations.

subprocesses.name: Investment Management
subprocesses.description: Overseeing the organization's investment portfolio.

subprocesses.name: Portfolio Analysis
subprocesses.description: Analyzing investment portfolio performance.

subprocesses.name: Risk Assessment
subprocesses.description: Assessing and mitigating investment risks.

subprocesses.name: Financial Risk Management
subprocesses.description: Identifying, analyzing, and mitigating financial risks.

subprocesses.name: Risk Identification
subprocesses.description: Identifying potential financial risks.

subprocesses.name: Risk Mitigation
subprocesses.description: Developing strategies to mitigate identified risks.

dependencies.description: Budgeting provides the financial data necessary for accurate financial statement preparation.
Compliance with regulatory standards is crucial for effective financial risk management.
Effective cash management ensures that resource allocation decisions are based on current liquidity.
Forecasting provides insights that inform investment management strategies.
Management reporting can influence financial forecasting by highlighting areas of concern or opportunity.
